Name: containerboard production, fluting medium, semichemical | turpentine | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1702:Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard and of containers of paper a
Description: Average of present used technology;The semichemical cooking process is a slightly alkaline cooking process with sodium sulphite and sodium carbonate as active cooking chemicals with a pulp yield of around 80%. The pulp produced is defiberized in refiners, screened and washed before being sent to the paper mill. Semichemical fluting is normally a one ply product and therefore requires a paper machine with one head box and normally also one wire.
